meanings.definition: To walk quietly and carefully on the balls of the feet.
meanings.sent1: She had to tiptoe past the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent2: He likes to tiptoe around the house when everyone is asleep.
meanings.sent3: The ninja tiptoed through the dark hallway, trying not to make a sound.
meanings.sent4: As the spy tiptoed closer to the target, his heart raced with anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The ballet dancer's graceful tiptoe entrance captivated the audience.

meanings.sent1: She painted her tiptoe nails with sparkly polish.
meanings.sent2: The ballerina balanced perfectly on her tiptoe during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The tiny bug crawled along the edge of her tiptoe.
meanings.sent4: The hiker felt a sharp pain in his tiptoe after stubbing it on a rock.
meanings.sent5: The baby's chubby tiptoe peeked out from under the blanket.

meanings.sent1: The cat began to tiptoe closer to the bird feeder.
meanings.sent2: He decided to tiptoe out of the room to avoid waking his roommate.
meanings.sent3: The detective tiptoed around the crime scene, searching for clues.
meanings.sent4: The thief tiptoed through the dark alley, trying to avoid detection.
meanings.sent5: The explorer tiptoed through the ancient ruins, careful not to disturb anything.
